thread.title: China roles out more flexible reserve ratio
thread.title_full: China roles out more flexible reserve ratio | Business Spectator

author: Dow Jones newswires
title: China roles out more flexible reserve ratio
text:
China will give its banks greater flexibility in how they account for the money they are required to keep in reserve, giving them access to extra funds during liquidity shortages.
The People's Bank of China said on Friday that it issued new rules allowing banks to let the reserves they keep at the central bank fall one percentage point below the required government level on a daily basis. That required level, called the reserve-requirement ratio, is currently at 18 per cent of deposits for major banks.
Banks must still meet the reserve requirement on an average basis, the central bank said, without specifying a timeframe.
"The new rules could provide a buffer to the financial institutions," the central bank said in a separate statement. "It can also boost efficiency of the capital and offer some liquidity when there is a shortage."
The rules are effective beginning on Tuesday.
The central bank said the new rules won't bring much effect to the market liquidity condition which now is ample, and it will provide the market enough funds via open market operations to guide a stable credit growth.
